item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Alan Watts
item.description: "The menu is not the meal." -- Alan Watts

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Nicholas Tharcher
item.description: "Inevitably it follows that anyone with an independent mind must become 'one who resists or opposes an authority or established convention': a <i>rebel</i>. ...And if enough people come to agree with—and follow—the <i>REBEL</i>, we now have a <i>DEVIL</i>. Until, of course, still more people agree. And then, finally, we have ... <i>GREATNESS</i>." -- Nicholas Tharcher

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Tom Wolfe
item.description: "A cult is a religion with no political power." -- Tom Wolfe

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Tom Petty
item.description: "Excuse me if I have/some place in my mind/where I go time to time." -- Tom Petty

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Leonard Bernstein
item.description: "Music . . . can name the unnameable and communicate the unknowable." -- Leonard Bernstein

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "One good thing about music, when it hits you, you feel no pain." -- Bob Marley

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "belief is the death of intelligence." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "I mean, if Beethoven had been killed in a plane crash at twenty-two, the history of music would have been very different. As would the history of aviation, of course." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Robert Fripp
item.description: "Music is the wine that fills the cup of silence." -- Robert Fripp

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Babe Ruth
item.description: "Every strike brings me closer to the next home run." -- Babe Ruth

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. " -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by John Cage
item.description: "If you develop an ear for sounds that are musical it is like developing an ego. You begin to refuse sounds that are not musical and that way cut yourself off from a good deal of experience." -- John Cage

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Without deviation from the norm, progress is not possible." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Alfred Korzybski
item.description: "The map is not the territory." -- Alfred Korzybski

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "...reality is always plural and mutable." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "...when dogma enters the brain, all intellectual activity ceases. " -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "...an optimistic mind-set finds dozens of possible solutions for every problem that the pessimist regards as incurable." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "We look for the Secret - the Philosopher's Stone, the Elixir of the Wise, Supreme Enlightenment, 'God' or whatever...and all the time it is carrying us about...It is the human nervous system itself." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Keith Richards
item.description: "If you're going to kick authority in the teeth, you might as well use two feet." -- Keith Richards

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "If it turns out that there is a God...the worst that you can say about him is that basically he's an underachiever." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "You're not to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or says it." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Nikola Telsa
item.description: "Our virtues and our failings are inseparable, like force and matter. When they separate, man is no more." -- Nikola Telsa

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Nicholas Tharcher
item.description: "The essence of independence has been to think and act according to standards from <i>within</i>, not <i>without</i>: to follow one's own path, not that of the crowd." -- Nicholas Tharcher

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Hazrat Inayat Khan
item.description: "We grown-up people think that we appreciate music, but if we realized the sense that an infant has brought with it of appreciating sound and rhythm, we would never boast of knowing music. The infant is music itself." -- Hazrat Inayat Khan

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Benjamin Spock
item.description: "Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do." -- Benjamin Spock

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The legitimate powers of government extend to such acts only as are injurious to others. It does me no injury for my neighbor to say there are twenty gods or no god. It neither picks my pocket nor breaks my leg." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Lawrence add a quote by Gene Rodenberry
item.description: "Can all this just be an accident? Or could there be some alien intelligence behind it?" -- Gene Rodenberry
